issue.title: Change Java baseline to 17 for 6.0

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Motivation

Java 8 is the current baseline of JUnit 5. It was released over 10 years ago and recent versions of Java have introduced many enhancements that make moving to a more recent JDK as the baseline for JUnit alluring. Moreover, there is movement in the ecosystem regarding this issue. For example, Spring has [changed their baseline](https://spring.io/blog/2022/03/28/an-update-on-java-17-adoption) to JDK 17+ with 6.x and free support for 5.x will end in 2024. Similarly, AssertJ will [move to Java 17](https://github.com/assertj/assertj/issues/3442). Therefore, we should consider making a similar move. Doing so would mean bumping the major version number and would allow us to clean up and simplify a number of things. This issue serves as a starting point for collecting those topics and tasks. For users stuck on Java 8 we will extend support for the last 5.x release for at least a year and backport security and important bug fixes to 5.x.

## Todos

- [x] https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/4249
- [x] Remove deprecated code
- [x] Clean up `ConsoleLauncher` CLI (remove single-dash long options and mode without subcommand)
- [x] Look for issues labeled with `type: breaking change` and decide whether they can be addressed in 6.0
- [x] Remove some if not all multi-release JAR code
- [x] https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/4575
- [x] Support `AutoCloseable` instead of `CloseableResource` in `Store`?
- [x] Remove `@TempDir` per context mode
- [x] ~Change default behavior for `TestInstancePostProcessor` and similar extensions wrt. method-level `ExtensionContext`?~ Too early for that
- [x] https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/4576
- [x] https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/4577
- [x] Bump Kotlin language version to latest stable
- [x] #4579
- [x] Remove `ReflectionUtils.isRecord*` methods and replace with calls to `Class.isRecord()`
- [x] Use `List.of` etc. instead of `Collections.emptyList` etc.
- [x] https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/4578
- [x] Add nullability annotations to public API (use jspecify)
- [x] Replace reflection in `JRE.determineCurrentVersion()`
- [x] Resolve `TODO [#4246]` comments within the code base

rename.to: Discontinue junit-platform-jfr and move listeners to junit-platform-reporting

body: I thought about this a bit more. I think it would be better to move the JFR functionality into `junit-platform-launcher` so it's available for everyone. We don't need to use the `ServiceLoader` registration but can register them programmatically when creating the `Launcher`.

rename.from: Discontinue junit-platform-jfr and move listeners to junit-platform-reporting
rename.to: Discontinue junit-platform-jfr and register listeners programmatically in junit-platform-launcher

body:
> I thought about this a bit more. I think it would be better to move the JFR functionality into `junit-platform-launcher` so it's available for everyone. We don't need to use the `ServiceLoader` registration but can register them programmatically when creating the `Launcher`.

Are you saying that they would no longer be "optional" and that they would always be "active"?
Yes, I think that should be ok since JFR claims to have very little overhead (< 1% according to their claims). We could introduce a configuration parameter to enable/disable them, though.

issue.title: Test auto-labeling PRs

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Testing PR auto-labeling...

Resolves #4579.

(not really, just so GitHub links it...)

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [ ] Method [preconditions](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [ ] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [ ] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [ ] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [ ] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)

body:
> Yes, I think that should be ok since JFR claims to have very little overhead (< 1% according to their claims).

Sounds good!

> We could introduce a configuration parameter to enable/disable them, though.

Those parameter then would control the registration of JUnit events via https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/jfapi/manually-register-and-unregister-event.html - as the enable/disable state of events is a recording-time defined property.

issue.title: Move JFR functionality into junit-platform-launcher

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Resolves #4579.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
